title: 110_s3442
content: The National Oilheat Research Alliance Act of 2000 is outlined in Section 1. The National Oilheat Research Alliance Act of 2000 is amended to replace "oilheat" with "oilheat fuel" in various sections, including definitions related to distillate liquid used for nonindustrial heating purposes. The National Oilheat Research Alliance Act of 2000 is amended to replace "oilheat" with "oilheat fuel" in various sections, including definitions related to distillate liquid used for nonindustrial heating purposes. The term "distillate liquid" is redefined to include No. 1 distillate, No. 2 dyed distillate, or a liquid blended with either of these. The National Oilheat Research Alliance Act of 2000 is amended to replace "oilheat" with "oilheat fuel" and redefine "distillate liquid" to include various types of liquid fuels used for nonindustrial heating purposes. The National Oilheat Research Alliance Act of 2000 is amended to redefine "distillate liquid" and specify the membership composition of the Alliance. The National Oilheat Research Alliance Act of 2000 is amended to specify the membership composition of the Alliance, including representatives of retail marketers, wholesale distributors, and public members with expertise in oilheat fuel. Members must be full-time managerial owners or employees of the oilheat fuel industry. The National Oilheat Research Alliance Act of 2000 is amended to specify membership composition, including representatives of the oilheat fuel industry. Assessments are adjusted for calendar years 2008 and 2009. The National Oilheat Research Alliance Act of 2000 is amended to specify membership composition, including representatives of the oilheat fuel industry. Beginning in 2010, the annual assessment rate should cover the costs of plans and programs developed by the Alliance, not exceeding 1/2 of 1 cent per gallon of distillate liquid. Any increase in the assessment rate must be approved by 2/3 of the members at a scheduled meeting. The National Oilheat Research Alliance Act of 2000 is amended to specify membership composition and assessment procedures. Changes include replacing references to specific distillate types with "distillate liquid" and emphasizing consumer protection in market surveys. The National Oilheat Research Alliance Act of 2000 (Public Law 106-469) is amended to replace "oilheat" with "oilheat fuel" throughout the text. Violations section is revised to include a direct reference to a competing product. The sunset provision in Section 713 is repealed.
